Class MazeUIAStarHW1

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • MazeUIAStarHW1
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public final class MazeUIAStarHW1
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class defines the graphical user interface of the application for searching mazes using A-star search. An instance of the graphical user interface can be started by invoking the run() method of this class. The run method takes an instance of the MazeAStarHW1 class as a parameter and returns an instance of this class that will use the given parameter. The run method also starts the graphical user interface application. This class contains public methods that are necessary in the implementation of A-star search.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • hasBarricade

        public boolean hasBarricade(int x1,
                   int y1,
                   int x2,
                   int y2)
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method determines if there is a barricade in between two adjacent cells in the maze. A barricade between two adjacent cells in the maze means that there is no direct path (no edge) from a position (position1) to its adjacent position (position2) in the maze.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the x-coordinate of the cell in position1
        y1 - the y-coordinate of the cell in position1
        x2 - the x-coordinate of the cell in position2
        y2 - the y-coordinate of the cell in position2
        Returns:
        true if there is a barricade between position1 and position2, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • updateGUIState

        public void updateGUIState()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method updates the display of the maze in the graphical user interface application. This method should be called whenever a new node is added into the closed list in order to graphically reflect the newly expanded node in the GUI.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • getMazeSize

        public int getMazeSize()
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method returns the size of a dimension of the maze. Since the maze is square, knowledge of a dimension is enough to determine its overall size.
        Returns:
        the size of a dimension of the maze
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • getStartNode

        public MazeNodeAStarHW1 getStartNode()
                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method returns the root node that represents the starting cell in the maze.
        Returns:
        the root node that represents the starting cell in the maze
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • getGoalStateX

        public int getGoalStateX()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method returns the x-coordinate of the position of the goal cell in the maze.
        Returns:
        the x-coordinate of the position of the goal cell in the maze
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • getGoalStateY

        public int getGoalStateY()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method returns the y-coordinate of the position of the goal cell in the maze.
        Returns:
        the y-coordinate of the position of the goal cell in the maze
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • closedListContains

        public boolean closedListContains(MazeNodeAStarHW1 theNode)
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method determines if the closed list contains the specified node. More formally, this method returns true if and only if the closed list contains an element e such that (theNode==null ? e==null : theNode.equals(e)). This method merely invokes the contains() method of the underlying SortedSet representing the closed list.
        Parameters:
        theNode - the node whose presence in the closed list is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the closed list contains the specified node, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • closedListIsEmpty

        public boolean closedListIsEmpty()
                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method determines if the closed list is empty. This method merely invokes the isEmpty() method of the underlying SortedSet representing the closed list.
        Returns:
        true if the closed list is empty, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • closedListAdd

        public boolean closedListAdd(MazeNodeAStarHW1 theNode)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method adds the specified node to the closed list if it is not already present (optional operation). More formally, this method adds the specified node theNode to the closed list if the closed list contains no node e2 such that (theNode==null ? e2==null : theNode.equals(e2)). If the closed list already contains the node, the call leaves the closed list unchanged and returns false. This method merely invokes the add() method of the underlying SortedSet representing the closed list.
        Parameters:
        theNode - the node to be added to the closed list
        Returns:
        true if the closed list did not already contain the specified node, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • closedListGet

        public MazeNodeAStarHW1 closedListGet(MazeNodeAStarHW1 theNode)
                               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method retrieves the node similar to the given node from the closed list if there is such a node in the list. This method returns null if there is no similar node in the closed list. Two nodes are similar if they have the same state. This method is provided in order to facilitate updating a node that is already in the closed list.
        Parameters:
        theNode - the node whose similar node in the closed list is to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the similar node in the closed list or null if there is no such node
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • closedListRemove

        public boolean closedListRemove(MazeNodeAStarHW1 theNode)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method removes the specified node from the closed list if it is present (optional operation). More formally, this method removes a node e such that (theNode==null ? e==null : theNode.equals(e)), if the closed list contains such a node. This method returns true if the closed list contained the node (or equivalently, if the closed list changed as a result of the call). (The closed list will not contain the node once the call returns.) This method merely invokes the remove() method of the underlying SortedSet representing the closed list.
        Parameters:
        theNode - the node to be removed from the closed list, if present
        Returns:
        true if the closed list contained the specified node, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • closedListClear

        public void closedListClear()
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method removes all of the node from the closed list (optional operation). The closed list will be empty after this call returns. This method merely invokes the clear() method of the underlying SortedSet representing the closed list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • closedListSize

        public int closedListSize()
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method returns the number of nodes in the closed list. If the closed list contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE nodes, this method returns Integer.MAX_VALUE. This method merely invokes the size() method of the underlying SortedSet representing the closed list.
        Returns:
        the number of nodes in the closed list
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • isGoalNode

        public boolean isGoalNode(MazeNodeAStarHW1 theNode)
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method determines if the given node is a goal node. A goal node is a node that represents the goal cell of the maze.
        Parameters:
        theNode - the node to be determined if it is a goal node
        Returns:
        true if the given node is a goal node, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the search thread has been externally interrupted

      • run

        public static MazeUIAStarHW1 run(MazeAStarHW1 theMaze)
        This method creates an instance of this class (a graphical user interface) and runs it. This method takes an instance of the MazeAStarHW1 class whose doSearch() method will be invoked by the created instance of this class to perform the search.
        Parameters:
        theMaze - the instance of the MazeAStarHW1 class that the created instance of this class will use
        Returns:
        the created instance of this class that uses the given instance of the MazeAStarHW1 class
